Class Board

java.lang.Object
  Board

public class Board
extends java.lang.Object

Board.java - Keeps track of stone interactions on the go game board. This file is part of Hadama Go. Field Detail

stones

private Stone[][] stones
In go the game board is a square grid on which stones are placed on the intersections of grid lines. Stones can have various "colors" like black (0) and white (1), but sometimes they're colors are non-visible values like -2 for yan (empty stones inside of a chain), -1 for empty intersections, 3 for black territory on the board and 4 for white territory.

chains

private java.util.ArrayList<Chain> chains
Stones that are horizontally or vertically adjacent on the game board form chains. In go, creating chains is advantageous at times because a chain is harder to capture than a single stone. Chains have liberties or qis, which are the open intersections horizontally or vertically adjacent to the chain's stones. A chain is captured by an enemy when its liberties are all taken away. Chains also have yan, which are open intersections inside a chain. With two true yan, a chain is living and cannot be capture by enemy stones.

komi

private double komi
Since the player with black stones has first move advantage, the white player gets compensation or komi of 2.5 extra points in the game.

illegalMovesforBlack

private java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> illegalMovesforBlack
Keep track of intersections where it's not legal to place black stones on the game board.

illegalMovesforWhite

private java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> illegalMovesforWhite
Keep track of intersections where it's not legal to place white stones on the game board.

size

private int size
size is the height or width of the game board. Traditionally, Go is played on a 19 by 19 sized board. Other standard dimensions include 13 by 13 and 9 by 9. Hard coded in HadamaGo.java you can find the size of the board displayed on the GUI. If the board is created from an artificial intelligence or machine learning algorithm, then its size must be obtained from this class.
